messages.subject: Sort of off-topic, but sorta not...Salad Fingers
messages.msgSnippet: It s sort of on topic because it s related to Our Unschooled Life. Every year everyone in our immediate family (Beth, Julian, and I) makes a gift for each
messages.messageBody:
It's sort of on topic because it's related to Our Unschooled Life.

Every year everyone in our immediate family (Beth, Julian, and I) makes a
gift for each other, then we open them Christmas eve. It's sometimes harder as
Julian gets older to think of something, but I was SOO happy with what I made
for him, and he loved it, so I wanted to share.

Salad Fingers is a weird online video series. He's creepy and has an
interesting little voice that Julian can copy extremely well. You can see him here:
_http://www.fat-pie.com/salad.htm_ (http://www.fat-pie.com/salad.htm)

Anyway, I made Julian a Salad Fingers doll on the knitting looms. The
picture is on my knitting loom lens here: _http://www.squidoo.com/loomknit/_
(http://www.squidoo.com/loomknit/) It's with the other pictures near the bottom.

Julian made me a great duct tape crochet hook holder and Beth a duct tape
wallet. I made Beth a melted bead bowl. Beth knitted me a gorgeous bamboo yarn
shawl, and made Julian a collage about the marriage equality fight that he
worked so hard for.

It was a really nice Christmas eve.

Kathryn



Come to the Northeast Unschooling conference Memorial Day Weekend, May 23-25
2008 in Peabody, Massachusetts _www.northeastunschoolingconference.com_
(http://www.northeastunschoolingconference.com/)
